overview: From 2025-07-28 to 2025-07-29, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 2 new PRs (0 merged), 4 new issues, and 8 active contributors.

topIssues.title: min-base-fee: add `minBaseFee` configuration variable to `SystemConfig` contract
topIssues.author: geoknee
topIssues.body:
A new method should be added

```solidity
function setMinBaseFeeLog2(uint8 minBaseFeeLog2) external onlyOwner;
```

which emits a `ConfigUpdate` event with a new `UpdateType`: `UpdateType.MINIMUM_BASE_FEE`.

See ratified design doc https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/design-docs/pull/295

topIssues.title: alert when non-flashblocks-enabled sequencer is active or flashblocks are turned off
topIssues.author: yashvardhan-kukreja
topIssues.body:
We plan to enable flashblocks with a backup sequencer with no flashblocks components. And in case, leadership transfer converges to the backup sequencer, that can be representative of an issue with flashblocks.

Have an alert for that i.e. when the leadership is stuck at a non-flashblocks-enabled sequencer.

Moreover, this alert should cover the scenario when the active sequencer is turned off with flashblocks or is not producing them. It's critical for EOC to know if flashblocks production is impacted intentionally (due to rollup-boost killswitch) or unintentionally

topIssues.title: alert on low peer count health of flashblocks-enabled sequencer
topIssues.author: yashvardhan-kukreja
topIssues.body:
Considering the criticality on the presence of healthy peers of a flashblocks-enabled sequencers, we should have an alert capturing the situation when the peer count drops below a number like 3 or 4.

This alert should span across non-leader sequencers as well.

topPRs.title: feat: introduce configurable min basefee
topPRs.author: wlawt
topPRs.body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

From: https://github.com/wlawt/optimism/pull/10

**Description**

<!--
A clear and concise description of the features you're adding in this pull request.
-->

This PR lets the rollup [configure the minimum base fee](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/design-docs/blob/main/protocol/minimum-base-fee.md) via `SystemConfig`.


**Tests**

<!--
Please describe any tests you've added. If you've added no tests, or left important behavior untested, please explain why not.
-->

- Expanded test coverage for existing unit tests that referenced Holocene/EIP1559Params
- Added acceptance tests: `op-acceptance-tests/tests/jovian/min_base_fee_test.go`
- Added fork tests:
   - `op-e2e/actions/proofs/jovian_activation_test.go`
   - `op-e2e/actions/upgrades/jovian_fork_test.go`
- Added e2e tests:
    - `op-e2e/system/fees/minbasefee_test.go`

**Additional context**

<!--
Add any other context about the problem you're solving.
-->

**Metadata**

<!-- 
Include a link to any github issues that this may close in the following form:
- Fixes #[Link to Issue]
-->


TODO:
- [x] Add acceptance tests
- [x] Add op-e2e/actions/upgrades/ for jovian

topPRs.title: fix superchainConfig upgrade issue & support multiple superchainConfigs
topPRs.author: AmadiMichael
topPRs.body:
This PR includes the following:

- Fix for the superchainConfig upgrade bug via comparison using a new SemverComp library.
- Separate the superchainConfig upgrade logic into it's own function.
- Make the OPCM (asides the `deploy` function) to support custom superchainConfigs.
- Modify the `opcm-upgrade-check` script to check the new `upgradeSuperchainConfig` function too.
- Tests added/modified for the above 4 changes.

topContributors.summary: wlawt: Focused on introducing a configurable minimum base fee, evidenced by two open PRs: ethereum-optimism/op-geth#648 and ethereum-optimism/optimism#16852.

sebastianst: Focused on a significant update to `op-geth`, merging PR #652 which incorporated `go-ethereum v1.16.1` with substantial changes (+8448/-2386 lines), demonstrating a focus on core system maintenance and upgrades.

AmadiMichael: Focused on addressing a bug related to superchain configuration upgrades, reflected in their open PR ethereum-optimism/optimism#16838, which involved modifying 2 files with a primary focus on bugfix work. Their contributions today primarily involved work on tests and configuration files.

geoknee: Focused on the foundational work for a new "min-base-fee" feature, creating multiple issues to track its implementation across different repositories, including ethereum-optimism/op-geth#650, ethereum-optimism/op-geth#649, and ethereum-optimism/optimism#16839, and closing the specification issue ethereum-optimism/specs#742.

yashvardhan-kukreja: Focused on proactive system health monitoring by creating two issues in ethereum-optimism/optimism, specifically to alert on low peer count health for flashblocks-enabled sequencers (#16868) and to flag when non-flashblocks-enabled sequencers are active or flashblocks are enabled (#16867).
mslipper: Focused on release management, creating a new issue (ethereum-optimism/optimism#16843) to track the rollout and release of the op-batcher.
